availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Abram C. Yager (Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Hardin Yager in Oldham County, Kentucky, in May 1840. Father of E. H. Yager. Farmer in Oldham County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Farmer in Oldham County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 150A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 895.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 170A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Oldham County Marriages, Film 000482446.
"Abram Clore Yager (1813-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial 79237085, accessed March 21, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/79237085.
